Yes, there are many apps and online resources that offer guided imagery or breathing exercise videos that can help manage anxiety and shortness of breath. Here are some suggestions:

1. Headspace: This app offers guided meditations, breathing exercises, and visualization tools to help reduce stress and anxiety. 2. Calm: Calm is another popular meditation app that provides guided meditations, breathing exercises, and sleep stories to help relax your mind and body. 3. Breathe2Relax: This app is specifically designed to help with breathing exercises by teaching users how to regulate their breathing through visual and audio cues. 4. Mindful Breathing: This YouTube video, narrated by a certified yoga instructor, offers a simple guided breathing exercise to help reduce anxiety and improve breathing. 5. UCLA Mindful Awareness Research Center: This website offers a variety of free guided meditations and mindfulness exercises to help manage anxiety and promote relaxation. Remember, always consult with your healthcare provider before beginning any new exercise or relaxation routine.
